image.name: H000102_001

profileText: A Representative from Indiana; born in Fort Wayne, Ind., June 7, 1834; attended the common schools and was graduated from Wabash College, Crawfordsville, Ind., in 1854; studied law at Harvard University; was admitted to the bar in 1859 and commenced practice in Fort Wayne, Ind.; elected as a Democrat to the Forty-fourth and Forty-fifth Congresses (March 4, 1875-March 3, 1879); resumed the practice of law; died in Fort Wayne, Ind., May 9, 1895; interment in Lindenwood Cemetery.

asset.name: H000102_001
asset.creditLine: Image courtesy of the Library of Congress

researchRecord.name: In the Hamilton Family papers, 1788-1963, 51 boxes.
researchRecord.description: Finding aid available in the repository.
